title: Browns' Watson using doubters as comeback fuel
content: Browns quarterback Deshaun Watson has a message for anyone questioning if he'll be able to return from the latest setback in his career.

title: Sources: Lazard taking pay cut to stay with Jets
content: Ending months of speculation, wide receiver Allen Lazard agreed to a significant pay cut to remain with the Jets, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Herro moment backfires for Heat star in defeat
content: Tyler Herro opted to pull up for a 3-pointer rather than drive for a wide-open layup. He missed, and the Heat lost to the Bulls 119-111 in a game with major seeding implications Wednesday night.

title: Watson doubts PGA Tour-LIV deal happens soon
content: Tom Watson doesn't believe the PGA Tour and LIV Golf will be able to reunify men's professional golf anytime soon.

title: Jokic calls Malone firing 'heavy day for everybody'
content: Nikola Jokic, after recording his 33rd triple-double of the season in the Nuggets' 124-116 win over the Kings, discussed the firing of Michael Malone and the team's playoff outlook.

title: Luka wipes away tears, then whips Mavs in return
content: Luka Doncic's eyes welled up with tears during a pregame tribute in Dallas, and then he proceeded to dominate the Mavericks with a season-high-tying 45 points in an emotional 112-97 victory.

title: Messi's 'greatness' guides Miami into CCC semis
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano attributed Lionel Messi's decisive goal and his "greatness" to their 3-1 comeback victory against LAFC, which secured a spot in the Concacaf Champions Cup.

title: Wild Wednesday: Celebrini 1 of 4 to net hat trick
content: Sharks rookie star Macklin Celebrini had three goals and two assists in an overtime loss to the Wild, accounting for one of the league's four hat tricks Wednesday.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Mets, Cubs make huge leaps in Week 2
content: The team in Queens passed its torpedo-powered Bronx counterpart, while the Cubs cracked the top 10. Who else rose or fell?

title: Ohio State's Will Howard believes he's the best QB in this NFL draft class
content: Howard says confidence in himself helped him face adversity, reach NFL draft class with 'unbelievable talent.'

title: 'That's just Ovi': How a true original set a goal-scoring record
content: Unorthodox as some of his methods might seem, the Capitals' star set a mark that might never be broken.

title: How Paige Bueckers’ game will translate to the WNBA
content: Only Caitlin Clark and Sue Bird have averaged 10 PPG and 5 APG as WNBA rookies, a group Bueckers should aspire to join.

title: Talking points: Is anyone brave enough to write off Madrid?
content: Three goals are surely enough to see Arsenal through to the semis, right? ESPN's writers tackle that, and some of the other most burning Champions League questions.

title: Raphinha apologizes to Cubarsi for stolen goal
content: Raphinha apologized to Pau Cubarsí for stealing his goal after opening the scoring in Barcelona's 4-0 Champions League quarterfinal rout against Borussia Dortmund at the Olympic Stadium on Wednesday.

title: PSG star's goal lives up to 'Kvaradona' nickname
content: A wonder goal from Khvicha Kvaratskhelia upstaged a brilliant curling shot from teammate Désiré Doué as Paris Saint-Germain beat Aston Villa 3-1 in the first leg of the Champions League quarterfinals on Wednesday.

title: Huijsen refuses to rule out Real Madrid transfer
content: Dean Huijsen has not ruled out a move to Real Madrid in the future while confirming he has a release clause included in his contract with Bournemouth.

title: U.S. Soccer settles Relevent antitrust lawsuit
content: Relevent and the U.S. Soccer Federation have settled their antitrust lawsuit, paving the way for foreign league matches to be played in the United States.

title: Emre Can rips 'soft' Dortmund after Barça mauling
content: Borussia Dortmund captain Emre Can launched an angry tirade against his teammates after his side were thrashed 4-0 by Barcelona in their Champions League quarterfinal first leg on Wednesday.

title: Source: Salah edging closer to new Liverpool deal
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah is edging closer to signing a new deal at Anfield, a source confirmed.

title: Olympics: More women's teams than men's in L.A.
content: Female athletes will be in the majority at an Olympics for the first time at the 2028 Los Angeles Summer Games thanks to a big win for women's soccer, which will now feature 16 teams.

title: McIlroy vs. Scheffler: Contrasting styles, but both the clear favorites in Augusta
content: The Masters isn't match play between two golfers. But given their recent performances, Scottie Scheffler and Rory McIlroy both figure to be in the mix when Sunday comes around.

title: 'Violence. Lots of violence': What to expect in Patricio Pitbull's UFC debut
content: One of the best fighters to never have competed in the UFC -- until now -- looks to prove himself at UFC 314.

title: Midseason update: Biggest storylines, surprises and second-half preview
content: With half the season already in the books, our experts break down what they've enjoyed the most so far and what to expect in the second half.

title: From Lobo's 1995 champs to Bueckers' 2025 crown: Ranking all 12 UConn title teams
content: Paige Bueckers helped UConn win its 12th NCAA championship, and first since 2016. Where does this title rank?

title: High school teammates Max Fried and Jack Flaherty make first MLB starts against each other
content: In 2012, future major leaguers Jack Flaherty and Max Fried (as well as Lucas Giolito) all shared the same high school dugout for Harvard-Westlake.

title: Cam Ward, Shedeur Sanders and the shared weakness that could make or break their NFL careers
content: Hanging on to the ball too long is a tough habit to break. Can the NFL draft's top QBs get their throws out quicker in the pros?

title: The USWNT doesn't have a No. 1 goalkeeper and it's unclear who will start at World Cup
content: After years of Alyssa Naeher and Hope Solo dominating, the USWNT is without a No. 1 goalkeeper ahead of the 2027 Women's World Cup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barça, Saudi clubs eye move for Díaz
content: Barcelona are facing competition to sign Liverpool's Luis Díaz. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 26/11 Plotter Tahawwur Rana Lands In Delhi, Arrested Under Anti-Terror Act
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, India's most wanted for his role in the 26/11 terror attacks in Mumbai, has landed in Delhi. He was extradited from the US on a special flight on Wednesday and will now face the law.

title: Live Updates: Tahawwur Rana Lands In Delhi, To Be Produced In Court Shortly
content: Tahawwur Rana Extradition Live Updates: Mumbai terror attack case accused Tahawwur Hussain Rana was successfully brought back to India from the US on Thursday.

title: "I Bow To Statue Of 26/11 Hero Tukaram Omble": Cop Who Caught Ajmal Kasab
content: The extradition of Tahawwur Rana, brought back to India to face the law for his role in 26/11 attacks in Mumbai that killed 166 people, is a justice not for the martyrs, but every Indian, said Hemant Bhavdhankar.

title: "Very Clear That...": What Pak Said On Tahawwur Rana Facing Justice In India
content: Pakistan has distanced itself from Tahawwur Rana - a Pakistani-Canadian terrorist wanted by India for his role in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks in which 166 people were slaughtered.

title: 'Don't Want To End Up In A Drum': UP Man Says Will Leave Cheating Wife
content: A man who allegedly caught his wife and her lover together in his house complained to the police that he does not want to live with her anymore as he could be murdered and his body kept in a drum.

title: "Unmarried Major Parents Can Live Together": Allahabad High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has granted police protection to an interfaith live-in couple while it hears a plea by their minor daughter alleging threats from her mother's former in-laws.

title: Why Trump Hit 90-Day Pause On Tariffs For All Countries, Except China
content: Donald Trump announced a 90-day pause on tariffs for all countries, except China - for which he announced an immediate increase in tariffs to 125 per cent.

title: "She Invited Trouble": Allahabad High Court Judge's Bail Order In Rape Case
content: Weeks after an Allahabad High Court judge observed that grabbing breasts or snapping a pyjama string do not constitute rape or attempt to rape, his colleague has granted bail to a rape accused, noting that the victim "invited trouble"

title: Dhoni Makes Shock Return As CSK Captain After Gaikwad's Ruled Out Due To...
content: MS Dhoni is back as Chennai Super Kings captain. He will be the skipper of the five-time champions for the rest of the IPL 2025

title: Bihar Man Kills Daughter. Was Angry She Fled With Boyfriend To Delhi
content: The accused, Mukesh Singh, had also reportedly gone after the man to kill him, but he was not in the village.

title: "I Was Making A Choice...": Michelle Obama Opens Up About Divorce Rumours
content: Michelle Obama has spoken about stepping back from political events and shutting down rumours about her marriage.

title: IPL Live: After Fiery Opening, RCB Face Blow As Kohli Fails To Become 1st To...
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru vs Delhi Capitals LIVE Score, IPL 2025: Mohit Sharma has provided Delhi Capitals with their fourth wicket of the day as he removed Liam Livingstone

title: Who Is Anurag Bajpayee? Indian-Origin CEO Caught In Luxury Brothel Scandal
content: He was listed among numerous individuals in Boston-area court documents, accused of paying substantial hourly rates for sex services earlier in 2025.

title: Opinion: Bangladesh: Why Yunus Government Must Be Careful With 'Loose Talk'
content: One would have hoped that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's gesture of having a formal meeting with an Interim Adviser who has done virtually nothing to reach out to India, would have been used as an opportunity to initiate a fresh approach.

title: US Will Now Scrutinise Social Media Before Granting Immigration Benefits
content: The policy applies to immigrants seeking lawful permanent residence, foreign students, and those "affiliated with educational institutions linked to antisemitic activity".

title: Mumbai's Jal Vayu Vihar Was A 26/11 Target. How Tahawwur Rana Played A Role
content: Tahawwur Rana, accused of plotting the 2008 Mumbai attacks, has departed from the US and will reportedly land in Delhi this afternoon.

title: Trump's tariff war: 5 reasons why Xi Jinping isn't blinking
content: Donald Trump paused tariffs on most nations but increased levies on China. China retaliated and called for mutual respect in dialogue. The trade war threatens global supply chains and economic stability. Xi Jinping prepares for long-term confrontation, reducing reliance on the US. Both countries face economic pain, but neither leader is willing to back down. The situation is a deadlock.

title: MS Dhoni to lead CSK; Ruturaj Gaikwad ruled out of IPL 2025
content: Chennai Super Kings face a setback as Ruturaj Gaikwad is sidelined for the rest of IPL 2025 due to an elbow fracture. In a strategic move, MS Dhoni will reassume the captaincy, aiming to replicate his past successes. CSK’s IPL triumphs under Dhoni came in 2010, 2011, 2018, 2021, and 2023.

title: US: We will revoke or deny Visa if your social media posts are in support of ...
content: USCIS has officially announced that social media posts deemed anti-Semitic, particularly those supporting designated terrorist groups like Hamas and Hezbollah, can now lead to visa rejections or revocations. This policy, effective immediately, applies to student visas and Green Card applications. The Trump administration, through the State Department, has already revoked hundreds of international student visas under this premise.

title: New Record! Virat Kohli becomes first-ever player to ...
content: Virat Kohli etched his name in IPL history, becoming the first player to reach 1,000 boundaries during RCB's match against Delhi Capitals. His innings, though brief, showcased his enduring class, before being dismissed for 22. Delhi Capitals opted to bowl first after winning the toss, aiming to maintain their unbeaten record.

title: Jeff Bezos’ Mar-a-Lago dinner led to Melania’s $40M Amazon Prime project
content: Melania Trump has secured a $40 million deal with Amazon Prime Video for a documentary chronicling her life as First Lady, particularly during the Trump administration's return to the White House. Directed by Brett Ratner, the film will feature exclusive insights into her daily life, with appearances by Donald and Barron Trump.

title: Axar Patel provides major update on KL Rahul's role during toss
content: Delhi Capitals, led by Axar Patel, chose to bowl first after winning the toss against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Faf du Plessis replaced Samir Rizvi in Delhi's lineup, while Bengaluru remained unchanged. Axar mentioned KL Rahul would bat in the middle order and emphasized the importance of both spinners and fast bowlers in their bowling strategy.

title: Watch: Did Trump manipulate market as 'friends make $2.5bn and $900m'?
content: Donald Trump's social media post urging stock purchases coincided with a subsequent tariff pause announcement, sparking market speculation. The S&P 500 surged, raising questions about potential insider knowledge. Trump's mention of "DJT" also boosted Trump Media's stock, increasing his stake by $415 million.

title: World’s top 10 billionaires gain $135B after Trump’s tariff pause—who lost?
content: Following President Trump's tariff pause announcement, the world's top 10 billionaires collectively gained $135 billion, with Elon Musk leading the surge at $35.9 billion. Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, and Larry Ellison also saw significant increases. However, Bernard Arnault, CEO of LVMH, experienced a $5.70 billion loss, and the billionaires' collective net worth remains down for the year.

title: Delhi weather sees sudden turn: Rain, dust storms bring temperatures down
content: Delhi experienced a sudden weather shift with dusty storms bringing down temperatures after a warm night. The weather department forecasts rain and thunderstorms. The minimum temperature reached 25.9 degrees Celsius, the highest in three years for April, categorized as a 'warm night' by the IMD. Air quality is currently in the 'poor' category with an AQI of 243.

title: Strahan's daughter says she felt 'jealous' of twin sister during cancer treatment
content: Isabella Strahan, Michael Strahan's daughter, faced a challenging period after being diagnosed with cancer in 2023. During her treatment, she admitted to feeling jealous of her twin sister, Sophia, who was enjoying typical college experiences. Now recovered and back in college, Isabella is sharing her story and raising awareness about the disease alongside her family.

title: 'Captain Dhoni is back': Internet goes bonkers after Gaikwad injury
content: MS Dhoni will lead Chennai Super Kings again. Ruturaj Gaikwad is injured and will miss the rest of the IPL 2025. This news excites fans. Dhoni previously led CSK to five IPL titles. He took over the captaincy from Ravindra Jadeja in 2022. Now, he returns to lead the team. Fans are eager to see Dhoni's leadership.

title: 'It hurts': Pakistan's Shadab breaks silence on favouritism trolls
content: Shadab Khan is frustrated by persistent claims of favouritism due to his relationship with Saqlain Mushtaq, his father-in-law and PCB mentor. He defends his selection, emphasizing his seven-year career and contributions to Pakistan cricket. While acknowledging Saqlain's guidance, Shadab denies receiving preferential treatment and aims to consistently perform as a bowler for the team.

title: 'He was hand of the people': 26/11 fallen hero's father remembers son
content: K Unnikrishnan, father of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, hails Tahawwur Rana's extradition as a diplomatic triumph for India, emphasizing it as a crucial link in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks investigation.

title: How India won Tahawwur Rana extradition fight: 2 factors that turned the case
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a key figure in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, is being extradited to India from the US. India successfully countered the double jeopardy claim legally and leveraged its strong diplomatic ties with the US to secure Rana's extradition.

title: 'If negotiations not satisfactory ...': EU puts tariffs on hold for 90 days
content: The European Union has decided to halt its tariffs on goods from the United States for 90 days. This follows a similar move by US President Donald Trump. Ursula von der Leyen, European Commission President, confirmed this suspension to allow trade negotiations. However, she warned that countermeasures will be taken if talks fail.

title: Taliban morality enforcers arrest men for having wrong hairstyle or skipping mosque
content: The Taliban's morality police in Afghanistan are enforcing strict Islamic laws, detaining men for hairstyles and missed prayers, according to a U.N. report. These laws, implemented six months ago, cover various aspects of life, significantly impacting small businesses and exacerbating Afghanistan's economic struggles. Despite U.N. The report said that the morality police are detaining people arbitrarily without following any due process.

title: From duck to 39-ball ton! Priyansh follows Ponting's first-ball six advice
content: Priyansh Arya, rose to fame after hitting six sixes in a Delhi Premier League over, secured a lucrative IPL contract with Punjab Kings. Despite an initial setback with a golden duck, Arya, backed by his captain and coach, bounced back strongly. He smashed a six off the first ball against Chennai Super Kings, signaling his return to form.

title: How 'killer doctor' John Camm's chicken orders led MP cops to his hideout in UP
content: Dr. Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, alias Dr. John Camm, was apprehended in Prayagraj for allegedly performing unauthorized cardiac procedures at Damoh's Mission Hospital, leading to patient deaths. His fondness for chicken meat led police to him after he fled Damoh. Investigations revealed he used a false identity, adopting the name John Camm to avoid bias.

title: Om Puri's affair with househelp, Abhijeet Bhattacharya's jibe at SRK and other news
content: The entertainment world is buzzing with revelations and reflections! Om Puri's past affair confession before his wedding surfaces, while Rhea Chakraborty eyes a fresh start after receiving a clean chit. Abhijeet Bhattacharya voices his displeasure towards Shah Rukh Khan, and Deepika Padukone expresses her love for both Mumbai and Bengaluru, acknowledging their impact on her life.

title: Banned from IPL, Brook: 'franchise cricket can take a step back'
content: Harry Brook, England's new white-ball captain, commits to national duties. He prioritizes playing for England over franchise cricket for now. Brook aims to participate in all England series. He acknowledges the need for occasional breaks. Brook expresses his desire to win the Ashes. He will likely play in The Hundred.

title: Two J&K govt employees sacked over alleged terror links
content: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha sacked two government employees, Ishtiyaq Ahmad Malik and Basharat Ahmad Mir, over alleged terror links. Malik, a PWD senior assistant, aided Hizbul Mujahideen by providing shelter and logistics. Mir, an assistant wireless operator, shared critical information with a Pakistani intelligence operative.

title: Israel under scrutiny over Palestinian medics' deaths
content: Why did Israeli troops kill 15 Palestinian paramedics? Initially, Israel said they'd not been marked as medics and were terrorists. Footage seems to contradicts this, and there's mounting pressure for an investigation.

title: 'Modi govt rushing to take credit': Cong tells 'full story' on Rana extradition
content: Congress asserts that the extradition of 26/11 plotter Tahawwur Rana to India on April 10, 2025, is the result of sustained efforts initiated by the UPA government in 2009. P. Chidambaram stated that the Modi government is wrongly taking credit for the extradition, which is a culmination of diplomatic, legal, and intelligence work.

title: Why are asylum applications in Germany and EU down?
content: Recent data indicates a decline in asylum applications in Germany and across the EU, prompting experts to urge caution in interpretation. While figures show a downward trend, particularly from Syrian, Afghan, and Turkish nationals, this doesn't necessarily reflect improved global safety.

title: Tahawwur Rana in India: Lawyer who led extradition battle, to head NIA's case
content: Senior advocate Dayan Krishnan, who led India's successful extradition case against 26/11 Mumbai attack plotter Tahawwur Rana in the US, will now spearhead the NIA's prosecution in Delhi. Rana, a key accomplice of David Headley, is en route to India after his final appeal was rejected by the US Supreme Court on April 4.

title: 'He is Canadian': Pak disowns Rana ahead of India extradition
content: Tahawwur Rana, implicated in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, is set to be extradited to India after the US Supreme Court rejected his final appeal. Pakistan claims Rana is no longer a citizen, while the NIA prepares to take custody upon his arrival. Rana's role involved arranging passports for David Headley, enabling reconnaissance for the Lashkar-e-Taiba orchestrated attacks.

title: Rana did 8 recces, made 66 calls during last trip before 26/11 attack
content: Tahawwur Rana, a key figure in the 2008 Mumbai attack, faces extradition to India. Indian authorities reveal Rana's extensive contact with David Headley, totaling 231 calls during reconnaissance missions. Rana's immigration firm served as a front for Headley's activities.

title: Herd of animal puppets treks from Africa to Europe in climate action
content: A wildebeest, a gorilla and a giraffe were among the life-size puppets to begin a 20,000-kilometre (12,400-mile) trek across the globe Wednesday from the DR Congo capital, to raise awareness about migration due to climate change. "Some animals will die on the way," due to high humidity for instance, "just like in real life", Mpofu said.

title: Will Marcell Ozuna play tonight against Philadelphia Phillies? Latest updates
content: Marcell Ozuna left the April 7 game due to hamstring tightness. While technically "day-to-day," there is not yet an official report to either confirm or deny that he'll play tonight against the Phillies. He has been working out lightly, but his ultimate status will probably be determined shortly before the game. Fans can wait to hear pre-game reports to find out for certain.

title: CID 2: Graffiti artist calls out makers for using his artwork without credit
content: The iconic show CID faces controversy as ACP Pradyuman's shocking on-screen death coincides with allegations of copyright infringement. Graffiti artist Mooz accuses CID of using his YouTube artwork without permission in 'The Aftermath' episode, where the team investigates Pradyuman's death following Barbosa's bombing.

title: Man who trafficked 60 to Southeast Asia with fake jobs & sold each for $1,000, held
content: Mumbai man Manish alias ‘Maddy’ Gopi was arrested for trafficking around 60 youths to Myanmar and Thailand with fake job offers. Once there, they were sold to a Chinese cybercrime racket for $1,000 each and forced into online scams. Police are probing the wider international network and working to repatriate more victims still trapped abroad.

title: Hanuman Jayanti 2025: Date, time and significance of Hanuman Janmotsav in 2025
content: Devotees eagerly anticipate Hanuman Jayanti on April 12, 2025, a day dedicated to Lord Hanuman, celebrated on the Purnima Tithi. The festival marks the birth of Lord Hanuman, revered for his strength, devotion, and selfless service. Celebrations include temple visits, prayers, havans, and recitations of Hanuman Chalisa.

title: 7 parenting tips by Sadhguru that can be life changing
content: As a parent, your primary responsibility is to be there for your child - and not act as his/her boss. While it is true that your child should take your opinion on everything and anything that he/she does, it is equally true that you have to give them the freedom to make his/her own decisions too. Children do not appreciate someone hovering on their heads

title: Husband threatened with 'Meerut-style murder' after he catches wife with lover
content: In Gurugram's Basai Enclave, a cab driver named Mausam allegedly caught his wife with her lover, Naveen, who then assaulted him with a pistol. Naveen reportedly threatened Mausam, referencing a gruesome murder case in Meerut. The duo fled after neighbors intervened. Mausam, who married his wife against his family's wishes, has filed a police complaint.

title: Miffed at being denied loan, goon records banker’s trips to brothel
content: A Nagpur banker, denied a loan, found himself blackmailed by a goon who recorded his visits to a local brothel. The goon, Adesh Samudre, extorted gold and valuables worth Rs 2.35 lakh from the banker by threatening to expose his activities to his family.

title: Honey Singh reveals who is his favourite Indian cricketer
content: Yo Yo Honey Singh, during his "Millionaire Tour" in Kolkata, revealed MS Dhoni as his favorite cricketer, a shift from his earlier admiration for Sachin Tendulkar. Singh stated that meeting Dhoni transformed him into a die-hard fan, impressed by Dhoni's personality.

title: How Headley’s testimony exposed Tahawwur Rana’s 26/11 attacks terror link
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a key accused in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, is being extradited from the US to face justice in India. Rana, a Pakistani-born Canadian, allegedly assisted David Headley in reconnaissance and planning. His extradition could provide fresh leads into the conspiracy and Pakistan's role in the attacks.

title: Ambati Rayudu's unwavering MS Dhoni allegiance: 'I will always be a Thala’s fan'
content: Ambati Rayudu has been actively voicing his opinions during IPL 2025, reaffirming his unwavering support for CSK and MS Dhoni while also criticizing online trolls. He engaged in a heated exchange with Navjot Singh Sidhu, accusing him of changing loyalties, and also debated with Sanjay Bangar about Rohit Sharma's role in the Mumbai Indians team.

title: Panchayat in Thrissur to reap riches from fallow land
content: Sreenarayanapuram’s ‘Tharishu-rahitha panchayat’ scheme will identify and cultivate unused lands across all 21 wards. Apart from vegetables, crops such as coconuts, tapioca, medicinal herbs, bananas, and indigenous fruits will be farmed

title: Additional Chief Secretary reviews progress of new barrage construction and the Cauvery-Gundar river linking project
content: Mangat Ram Sharma asks officials to expedite the construction of the barrage across the Cauvery at Nanjai Pugalur and complete it within the stipulated time

title: Keralite youths caught in a cyber snare
content: Seven Keralites were among the 283 Indians who were recently rescued from the custody of cyber fraudsters in Myanmar and brought back to the country. Dinesh Kallungal, M.P. Praveen and Sam Paul A. catch up with the youths on their return to Kerala to unravel the murky world of human trafficking and cybercrime

title: Improve tax collections and become self-sufficient, MA&UD Minister Narayana tells Municipal Commissioners
content: With their delinking from CFMS, the Urban Local Bodies can retain and utilise the taxes collected for their own development, and give an impetus to providing quality essential services to the people, he says

title: Revamp of railway stations in Manapparai, Pudukottai is nearing completion
content: Manapparai railway station is likely to be ready in May while the ongoing modernisation work at Pudukottai station is expected to be completed by July

title: Nidhi shifted to child-care institute
content: With her parents from Jharkhand still missing, the hospital hands over Nidhi’s custody to District Child Protection Officer

title: Akali Dal to pick new chief amid challenges to its authority from rebel members
content: Rebels claims the party leadership has veered away from the directions of Akal Takht; senior leaders accuse rebels of allying with BJP, AAP and Congress to bring SAD down

title: Nitish should be made Deputy PM, wishes senior Bihar BJP leader Ashwini Kumar Choubey
content: However, his comments trigger sharp reactions from Opposition parties and even from the BJP, with a senior leader of the saffron party saying there is no such discussion

title: All arrangements in place for ‘Sita Rama Kalyanam’ at Vontimitta
content: ‘Kalyana Vedika’, the venue of the grand event, is fully decorated for the event which will be held between 6.30 p.m. and 7.30 p.m. on Friday

title: Tiruchi Corporation sends over 1,400 tonnes of non-recyclable plastics to cement factory
content: The city generates about 470 tonnes of waste daily with 75% of it being segregated at source; the non-recyclable plastics are to be used to as refuse-derived fuel at cement factories

title: One delicious step towards reducing plastic waste
content: Agriculture college students develop edible food wrappers that will help extend shelf life of products. The start-up is called Eden Wrap

title: Following attacks on Empuraan, committee for cultural resistance formed in Kerala
content: In light of the right-wing backlash faced by the film Empuraan, ‘Celebration of Democracy’ events, including anti-fascist film festivals, popular resistance meetings and cultural performances, will be organised across the State over the next three months.

title: Chhattisgarh ACB raids former MLA; activists cry foul
content: The searches are related to alleged embezzlement of bonus meant for distribution to tendu leaves gatherers. While the agency searched the premises of activist and former MLA Manish Kunjam, other activists say it was Mr. Kunjam who exposed the corruption and that he has been fighting the plunder of natural resources in Bastar for decades.

title: Adopting ideals of Lord Mahavir will bring lasting world peace, says Vice-Chancellor
content: Resource persons throw light on the life and contribution of the 24th Tirthankara during his 2,624th Jayanti celebrations in Belagavi

title: Digital calendar of festivals offers a glimpse into cultural diversity of Kerala
content: Calendar provides information on major festivals and celebrations of State and will serve as a quickly accessible guide to visitors

title: Annamayya police announce traffic diversions for Vontimitta temple festivities
content: Traffic restrictions will be in force from 10 a.m. Friday until 2 p.m. on Saturday and access will be limited exclusively to vehicles carrying devotees, while other vehicular movement will be restricted during this period, says SP

title: KSRTC revokes order on breath analyser tests for staff following alleged misuse
content: The corporation had recently issued an order revising its procedure for breath analyser tests after one of its drivers from Kozhikode, who had consumed a homoeopathic medicine before reporting for duty, tested positive for alcohol content on March 30

title: Astronomy NGOs create Kolkata’s “largest low-cost handmade telescope”
content: Built by young scientists and optical observers from OAC and IASES the telescope will create a unique opportunity for space research that will serve not just academic circles but the society at large

title: Students’ farewell gift to teacher draws praise from Kerala Chief Minister
content: On her retirement day, a teacher of a Vandanmedu school made her students place their hand on her head and take a pledge against narcotics. CM terms it an inspiring act of love

title: Rana’s extradition is an attempt to divert attention from real issues: Kanhaiya Kumar
content: Amit Shah not bothered about unemployment after getting his son positions at BCCI, ICC, says Congress leader; raises concerns about nepotism, corruption, inflation, poverty, poor healthcare

title: Over 1,000 students throng ‘Selesta 2K25’ youth festival in Chittoor
content: Telugu film actors Bharath and Kiran Abbavaram interact with students during the cultural programmes, which included performances by students from Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Maharashtra

title: Vachanas translated into 10 more languages, including Japanese, German and Spanish
content: Two-day workshop on translating the scriptures begins at Central University of Karnataka in Kalaburagi

title: BJP to carry out nationwide ‘Waqf Reform and Public Awareness Campaign’ from April 20 to May 5
content: The aim is to spread awareness about the benefits of the recently passed Waqf (Amendment) Act, particularly among the Muslims

title: Horticulture conclave to open new avenues for mango farmers, says Chittoor Collector
content: Appeals to the mango farmers from Chittoor and surrounding districts to attend the conclave in big numbers

title: Calicut varsity organises Chemistry camp for schoolchildren
content: 75 Class IX students from nearby schools, chosen with the support of Samagra Shiksha Kerala, attended the camp

title: RTI Act amendment won’t reduce transparency: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The amendment helps harmonise right to information and right to privacy laws, he says; activists say it will curtail access to information needed to expose corruption, abuse, and to hold governments accountable

title: Minister Somanna lays foundation stone for three road overbridges
content: These facilities will come up at Mydala Gate, Baddihalli Gate and Batwadi Gate in the Tumakuru region

title: State Food Commission visits tribal unnathis in Kollam
content: Civil Supplies officials directed to start mobile ration shops in Peruvaazhikkala and Randaam Mile and to provide ration cards to residents

title: NIA formally arrests Tahawwur Rana after his extradition from U.S.
content: In a statement, the NIA said the extradition happened after years of sustained and concerted efforts to bring the key conspirator behind the 2008 mayhem to justice.

title: CM receives salute at combined passing-out parade of recruit police constables
content: Pinarayi stresses the importance of preserving the high standards that the Kerala Police have set to maintain law and order

title: Ambulance driver found guilty of raping COVID-19 patient in Pathanamthitta
content: Incident occurred in September 2020 when Noufal of Kayamkulam was transporting the 19-year-old patient to a care centre

title: ASHAs urge Kerala government to offer a compromise formula to end their strike
content: KAHWA says it is willing to settle for a nominal hike of ₹3,000 for the time being. It clarifies that the strike is for a hike in honorarium and not incentives

title: Class 8 girl on menstruation made to sit outside classroom for exam in a private school near Coimbatore
content: The school correspondent has issued a suspension order to the school principal under Section 17 of the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009

title: Accused found guilty in Ambalamukku Vineetha murder case
content: Prosecution terms the case rarest of rare. Court seeks psychological, behavioural and social background reports, sentencing on April 21

title: CPI deplores Andhra Pradesh government requesting captive mines for Mittal Steel ignoring Vizag Steel
content: Neglecting VSP at the cost of new ventures like Mittal Steel was uncalled for, and such moves were inappropriate and unacceptable, says CPI State Secretary

title: Parents feel the pinch as private schools in Tiruchi increase fees
content: Educational institutions in Tiruchi are charging anywhere between ₹2,500 and  ₹10,000 and above for Lower Kindergarten in the new academic year

title: Raj Thackeray warns banks to use Marathi; threatens intensified protests by MNS
content: Mr. Thackeray emphasised that banks must adhere to the three-language formula — English, Hindi, and the regional language (Marathi in Maharashtra) — as mandated by the RBI

title: More T.N. farmers opt for TANUVAS Grand supplement for cows
content: The supplement, which reduces methane emissions by 25-30 litres per day per cow by helping micro organisms grow in the cow’s first stomach, was developed by V. Balakrishnan, retired professor and head, TANUVAS, and R. Murugeswari, associate professor, TANUVAS.

title: Andhra Pradesh truckers back Karnataka counterparts’ strike call from April 14
content: APLOA appeals to truck owners in Andhra Pradesh not to operate their vehicles in Karnataka from April 14

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up at the end of the regular season
content: the 2024-25 season wraps up Sunday but all eyes will be on Wednesday's clash with the Dallas Mavericks . the Sacramento Kings host the Denver Nuggets (ESPN, 10:30 p.m. ET), who will take the court for the first time since Tuesday's firing of an NBA coach . top playoff contenders are aiming to lock up their postseason spots .

title: Why Harvard's Harmoni Turner brings fun, flair to WNBA draft
content: HARMONI TURNER STORMS takes her knees to her chest . she wags her hips side to side and sticks her tongue out and locks eyes with each of her teammates . the entire team is shaking their hips and nodding their heads .

title: NHL Awards Watch: Final regular-season ballots for seven different trophies
content: the PHWA votes for the Hart, Norris, Calder, Selke and Lady Byng finalists, broadcasters vote for the Jack Adams, and general managers handle the Vezina . the final NHL Awards Watch of the 2024-25 season offers one last snapshot of the races just days before ballots are due to arrive in voters' inbox .

title: Barça quietly building one of the greatest UCL campaigns ever
content: barça beat Borussia Dortmund 4-0 to move to the brink of a first UEFA champions league semifinal since 2019 . a blistering team blew the club away at the Olympic Stadium on Wednesday . it's hard to see barça not setting up a final four meeting against either Bayern Munich or Internazionale .

title: Stanley Cup playoff watch: Which games matter the most Thursday?
content: the playoffs for the 2025 playoffs continue to rage, as does the jockeying for position in the draft lottery order . the two original six franchises will be back in the postseason again at some point, but not this season . they begin the evening eight points behind the Canadiens for the final wild-card spot .

title: Five of the biggest storylines to watch at the 2025 Masters
content: defending champion is in contention for a green jacket this week . a Sunday duel between Scheffler and McIlroy at Augusta National Golf Club would be fantastic . the 89th playing of the 2024 Masters is almost here .

title: How each team could win the national championship
content: the 2025 men's Frozen Four is the culmination of the NCAA hockey tournament . it features two teams with a lot of experience on this stage and two newcomers . the semifinal matchups will be Thursday at 5 and 8:30 p.m. ET at the Enterprise Center in St. Louis .

title: Fans in Dallas, still outraged, cheer Doncic's homecoming
content: the los Angeles Lakers came to town for the first time since the stunning trade that sent Luka Doni away . the loss of the Dallas Mavericks ' adored franchise player led the lakers to a 112-97 victory over his former team .

title: How does the F1 championship look heading into the Bahrain GP?
content: Max Verstappen has caught up to Lando Norris in the drivers' championship . the forecast is hot and sunny with daytime highs of 36°C from Friday through to Sunday . nighttime temperatures are expected to drop to around 22°C .

title: CFB's best receivers for 2025: Who lines up after the clear No. 1?
content: phenom Jeremiah Smith is the best receiver in college football in 2025 . he's the only player who came back with an undisputed winner . the list includes players who bounced back from injuries, transfers from last season .

title: From tears to triumph: Biggest takeaways from Luka's Dallas return
content: the Dallas Mavericks traded Luka Doncic to the los Angeles Lakers on febr. 2 . Doncic left the game with 45 points, 8 rebounds and 6 assists . he led the Lakers to a playoff spot for los Angeles in the process .
